class.name: DESedeKeySpec
class.javadoc:
This class specifies a DES-EDE ("triple-DES") key.
Jan Luehe
1.4
The constant which defines the length of a DESede key in bytes.

Creates a DESedeKeySpec object using the first 24 bytes in key as the key material for the DES-EDE key.

The bytes that constitute the DES-EDE key are those between key[0] and key[23] inclusive key the buffer with the DES-EDE key material. The first 24 bytes of the buffer are copied to protect against subsequent modification. NullPointerException if key is null. InvalidKeyException if the given key material is shorter than 24 bytes.

Creates a DESedeKeySpec object using the first 24 bytes in key, beginning at offset inclusive, as the key material for the DES-EDE key.

The bytes that constitute the DES-EDE key are those between key[offset] and key[offset+23] inclusive. key the buffer with the DES-EDE key material. The first 24 bytes of the buffer beginning at offset inclusive are copied to protect against subsequent modification. offset the offset in key, where the DES-EDE key material starts. NullPointerException if key is null. InvalidKeyException if the given key material, starting at offset inclusive, is shorter than 24 bytes

Returns the DES-EDE key.
the DES-EDE key. Returns a new array each time this method is called.

Checks if the given DES-EDE key, starting at offset inclusive, is parity-adjusted. key a byte array which holds the key value offset the offset into the byte array true if the given DES-EDE key is parity-adjusted, false otherwise NullPointerException if key is null. InvalidKeyException if the given key material, starting at offset inclusive, is shorter than 24 bytes
